conditions.name: Safety Review for Dose Escalation
conditions.description: Safety Review Committee must review safety data before dose escalation.
conditions.text: Before titration to 30 mg/day, the Safety Review Committee (SRC) will review available safety data through Day 23 for each participant.

conditions.name: ALT Elevation for Dose Modification
conditions.description: ALT elevation between 3 and 5 times the upper limit of normal.

conditions.name: Severe ALT Elevation for Discontinuation
conditions.description: ALT elevation greater than 5 times the upper limit of normal.

conditions.name: Neutropenia
conditions.description: Neutrophil count decreases more than 30% from baseline and is below the reference range.
conditions.text: > 30% ↓ from baseline Neutrophils below reference range at baseline

conditions.name: Potential Liver Injury (Hy's Law)
conditions.description: Concomitant elevation of Bilirubin and ALT.
conditions.text: Bilirubin > 2 × ULN Accompanied by ALT > 3 × ULN, indicative of liver injury

conditions.name: Neurologic Worsening
conditions.description: Evidence of neurologic worsening by adverse events or neurologic physical exam.
conditions.text: Evidence of neurologic worsening by AEs or by neurologic physical exam assessment

conditions.name: Psychiatric Worsening
conditions.description: Evidence of clinically significant acute psychiatric worsening.
conditions.text: Evidence of clinically significant acute psychiatric worsening which may include but not limited to suicidality, acute depression, or psychosis.

conditions.name: Pregnancy
conditions.description: Participant becomes pregnant or is planning to become pregnant.

transitionRules.name: Dose Escalation to 30mg/day
transitionRules.text: Following the Run-in Period, participants will be administered ALXN1840 at 15 mg/day for a treatment period of approximately 28 days followed by titration up to 30 mg/day on Day 29.

transitionRules.name: Dose Interruption for ALT Elevation
transitionRules.text: If ALT > 3 × ULN and ≤ 5 × ULN, temporary interruption of dosing is required.

transitionRules.name: Discontinuation for Severe ALT Elevation
transitionRules.text: If ALT > 5 × ULN, discontinue study intervention.

transitionRules.name: Dose Reduction for Neutropenia
transitionRules.text: If Neutrophils > 30% decrease from baseline and below reference range, reduce dose to previous dose level or to 15 mg QOD.

transitionRules.name: Dose Modification for Neurologic Worsening
transitionRules.text: Investigator and Alexion Medical Monitor will evaluate the need for dose modification (interruption, increase or decrease) based on copper control parameters and relevant clinical data.

transitionRules.name: Intervention Discontinuation for Pregnancy
transitionRules.text: Participants must be considered for discontinuation from study intervention if Pregnancy or planned pregnancy occurs.

transitionRules.name: Intervention Discontinuation for Disallowed Medication
transitionRules.text: Participants must be considered for discontinuation from study intervention if Use of disallowed medication occurs.

transitionRules.name: Intervention Discontinuation for Hypersensitivity
transitionRules.text: Participants must be considered for discontinuation from study intervention if a Serious hypersensitivity reaction occurs.

transitionRules.name: Intervention Discontinuation for Severe Infection
transitionRules.text: Participants must be considered for discontinuation from study intervention if a Severe uncontrolled infection occurs.

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Study Completion
scheduleTimelineExits.description: A participant is considered to have completed the study if he/she has completed all phases of the study including the last scheduled procedure shown in the Schedule of Activities (SoA).

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Participant Withdrawal of Consent
scheduleTimelineExits.description: A participant may withdraw from the study at any time at his/her own request.

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Investigator Discretionary Withdrawal
scheduleTimelineExits.description: A participant may be withdrawn at any time at the discretion of the Investigator for safety, behavioral, compliance, or administrative reasons.

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Lost to Follow-up
scheduleTimelineExits.description: A participant will be considered lost to follow-up if he or she repeatedly fails to return for scheduled visits and is unable to be contacted by the study site.

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Study Termination by Sponsor
scheduleTimelineExits.description: Alexion reserves the right to close the study site or terminate the study at any time for any reason at the sole discretion of Alexion.

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Site Closure for Non-Compliance
scheduleTimelineExits.description: Reason for early closure of a study site may include failure of the Investigator to comply with the protocol, the requirements of the IRB/IEC or local health authorities, Alexion’s procedures, or GCP guidelines.

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Site Closure for Inadequate Recruitment
scheduleTimelineExits.description: Reason for early closure of a study site may include inadequate recruitment of participants by the Investigator.

scheduledDecisionInstances.name: Dose Escalation Decision
scheduledDecisionInstances.description: Decision point to titrate dose from 15 mg/day to 30 mg/day, contingent on SRC safety review of data through Day 23.

scheduledDecisionInstances.name: Dose Modification Decision
scheduledDecisionInstances.description: Ongoing decision-making to reduce, interrupt, or discontinue study intervention based on emerging safety data.

scheduledDecisionInstances.name: Participant Discontinuation Decision
scheduledDecisionInstances.description: Decision to withdraw a participant from the study for reasons such as safety, non-compliance, or participant request.
